course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Molecular Characterization Chemistry Laboratory II
course.description: This is the laboratory course corresponding to the lecture courses CHEM 3320 and CHEM 3420. The topics of experiments covered in the laboratory course will be related to those taught in the lecture courses, such as quantum chemistry,  chemical instrumental analysis, etc. For CHEM students under the four-year degree only.
course.corequisites: CHEM 3320 AND CHEM 3420

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
1. Spectroscopic Evidence of Energy Quantisation from the UV-Visible Spectra of SO2, I2 and NH3 Gases
2. Molecular Emission Method: Spectrofluorometric Determination of Riboflavin Content in Multivitamin Tablet   
3. Illustration of 1-D Particle in a Box: Study of β–Carotene by UV Visible Spectroscopy
4. Atomic Absorption Method: Lead Content in Hair Dye Sample by Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS)
5. Electroanalytical Method: Determination of Chloride Content in Cracker Biscuit with Ion-Selective Electrode (ISE)
6. Visualisation of Molecular Orbitals of a Heteronucleus Diatomic Molecule Simulated by a Computational Software – Gaussian
reviews.comment_teaching:
For the first time offering online lab,
1. the files in canvas is in chaos (they upload files early but muted and you cant see it uploaded, then unmuted at specific time and canvas cannot notify us which usually it could, esp. when they need to update data)
2. Briefing (play a pretaped briefing video during online lecture)
3. but nice to answer our enquiry

but acceptable as first time online lab
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy

For the first time offering online lab in 13 consecutive working days,
Day 1: Briefing
Day 2: Expt 1
Day 3: Expt 2+Last expt enquiry
Day 4: Expt 3+Last expt enquiry
Day 5: Last expt enquiry
Day 6: Expt 4
Day 7: Expt 5+Last expt enquiry
Day 8: Last expt enquiry
Day 9: Expt 6
Day 10: Last expt enquiry
Day 11+12: Released score enquiry
Day 13: Oral Quiz

reviews.author: supermin
reviews.title: Similar style to CHEM 2350/2450
reviews.comment_content:
Expt 1: Spectroscopic Evidence of Energy Quantisation from the UV-Visible Spectra of SO2, I2 and NH3 Gases

Expt 2: Molecular Emission Method: Spectrofluorimetric Determination of Riboflavin in Vitamin Tablet

Expt 3: Illustration of 1-D Particle in a Box: Study of β-Carotene by UV-Visible Spectroscopy

Expt 4: Atomic Absorption Method: Lead Content in Hair Dye Sample by Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS)

Expt 5: Electroanalytical Method: Determination of Chloride Content in Biscuit Samples with Ion-Selective Electrode (ISE)

Expt 6: Visualisation of Molecular Orbitals of a Heteronucleus Diatomic Molecule Simulated by a Computational Software - Gaussian
reviews.comment_teaching:
She just plays her pre-recorded lab videos. They're also on Canvas

But, she does frequently pause and provide extra remarks and hints on solving the e-Report. Since there is no ZOOM recording uploaded, you won't be able to find them after class. Join lecture to listen through what she says.

She's kind and answers questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
60% e-Reports

20% Lab Quiz

20% Oral quiz (pick two questions, four minutes to solve all)
reviews.comment_workload:
e-Reports will take you 2~4 hours depending on amount of things to do

Lab Quiz is super easy.

Lab Oral is luck, if you manage to pick two calculation questions, good luck solving them in 4 minutes.
